net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class ProcessPoolExecutor

  • Object
    • ProcessPoolExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProcessExecutor, ProcessExecutorService
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaProcessPoolExecutor

    public class ProcessPoolExecutor
extends Object
implements ProcessExecutorService
    An implementation of the ProcessExecutorService interface for maintaining and managing a pool of pre-started processes. The processes are executed in instances of an own ProcessExecutor implementation. Each executor is assigned an instance of an implementation of the ProcessManager interface using an implementation of the ProcessManagerFactory interface. The pool accepts submissions in the form of Submission implementations which are executed in any one of the available active process executors maintained by the pool. While executing a submission, the executor cannot accept further submissions. The submissions are queued and executed as soon as there is an available executor. The size of the pool is always kept between the minimum pool size and the maximum pool size (both inclusive). The reserve size specifies the minimum number of processes that should always be available (there are no guarantees that there actually will be this many available executors at any given time). This class uses SLF4J for logging.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static long EVICT_TIME
      The number of milliseconds after which idle process executor instances and process executor threads are evicted from the object pool and the thread pool respectively.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProcessPoolExecutor

        public ProcessPoolExecutor(ProcessManagerFactory procManagerFactory,
                           int minPoolSize,
                           int maxPoolSize,
                           int reserveSize,
                           boolean verbose)
                    throws InterruptedException
        Constructs a pool of processes. The initial size of the pool is the minimum pool size or the reserve size depending on which one is greater. This constructor blocks until the initial number of processes start up. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the pool parameters and the rate of incoming submissions.
        Parameters:
        procManagerFactory - A ProcessManagerFactory instance that is used to build ProcessManager instances that manage the processes' life cycle in the pool.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        verbose - Whether the events related to the management of the process pool should be logged. Setting this parameter to true does not guarantee that logging will be performed as logging depends on the SLF4J binding and the logging configurations, but setting it to false guarantees that no logging will be performed by the constructed instance.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the manager factory is null, or the minimum pool size is less than 0, or the maximum pool size is less than the minimum pool size or 1, or the reserve size is less than 0 or greater than the maximum pool size.

      • execute

        public boolean execute(Submission<?> submission)
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutor
        Sequentially writes the specified commands to the process and blocks until they are processed. The result of the submission, if there is one, can be subsequently accessed by calling the Submission.getResult() method.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ProcessExecutor
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to execute.
        Returns:
        Whether the submission was executed. If the executor is not running, busy processing an other submission, or stopped before it could complete the execution of the submission, false is returned; otherwise the submission is processed and true is returned once it's successfully executed.

      • submit

        public <T> Future<T> submit(Submission<T> submission,
                            boolean terminateProcessAfterwards)
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Submits the specified submission for execution and returns a Future instance which allows for the cancellation of the submission. It does not block until the submission is processed. The termination of the executing process after the execution may be requested.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface ProcessExecutorService
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type variable of the submission.
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to execute.
        terminateProcessAfterwards - Whether the process to which the submission is delegated should be terminated after the execution of the submission.
        Returns:
        A Future instance that allows for the waiting for the completion of the execution, the cancellation thereof, or the retrieval of its optional result.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Initiates the orderly shutdown of the process pool. It does not affect the execution of previously submitted tasks. See ExecutorService.shutdown().
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface ProcessExecutorService

      • forceShutdown

        public List<Submission<?>> forceShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Kills all the and returns a list of the submissions that have been submitted but never processed. It does not block until the processes terminate. See ExecutorService.shutdownNow().
        Specified by:
        forceShutdown in interface ProcessExecutorService
        Returns:
        A list of the submissions that were awaiting execution.

      • awaitTermination

        public boolean awaitTermination(long timeout,
                                TimeUnit unit)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        It blocks until the ProcessExecutorService.isTerminated() method returns true or a timeout occurs. See ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, TimeUnit).
        Specified by:
        awaitTermination in interface ProcessExecutorService
        Parameters:
        timeout - The amount of time to wait for the pool's termination.
        unit - The unit of the amount.
        Returns:
        Whether the pool has successfully terminated or a timeout occurred.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while the method is blocking.
